criterion: Reward for capturing every explicit element from the transcript – clinician's assessment of a classic sinus infection, the exact intention to prescribe penicillin, specified 10-day course, and the patient's expressed agreement – with wording that is either verbatim or an accurate paraphrase.
Penalize for omitting any of the above transcript elements or for altering them (e.g., different diagnosis, different medication, different duration, or absence of patient response).
Reward for documenting medication details exactly as stated (name "penicillin" and 10-day duration) without adding unsourced dosage, frequency, or substitutions.
Penalize for inaccuracies in factual details such as medication name, duration, or misquotation of patient or clinician.
Reward for accurately incorporating the relevant chart allergy to penicillin (anaphylaxis, severe) while omitting unrelated chart data.
Penalize for fabricating additional clinical content (symptoms, exams, labs, counseling, follow-up plans, etc.) not supported by transcript or chart.
